result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke L Scruton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property - Firearm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence the defendant is serving.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

timeConds.notes: With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.  Court has no objection to electronic monitoring.  On January 18, 2017 - Court orders the jail sentence to commence within 60 days of the probation sentence starting.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: -To commence immediately and be consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: -Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-No Contact with the victim or victim's residence.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.
-AODA and any follow-up unless already done on another case.

of Sentencing after Revocation held on April 15, 2020, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Karen Blair - Court Reporter
AMENDED (as to sentence credit, per Agent)
Defendant in custody and present via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Vicki Jobling via video.

1:56 p.m. Defendant present in court via zoom video with Atty Vicki Jobling present via video.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin via zoom video.  Statement by Atty Jobling has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions. Court confirms the Courtroom/facility doors are open. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by DA Christenson. Sentencing statement by Atty Jobling.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-18 months of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision, consecutive to any other sentence and to commence immediately.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Restitution - $4383.04.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Court costs - $966.30.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-No Contact with the victim or victim's residence.
-AODA and any follow-up unless already done on another case.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP & SAR programs.
Court questions Atty Jobling regarding sentence credit.  Statement by Atty Jobling.

Court grants the defendant 366 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 2:13 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 15, 2020 at 01:45 pm.

9:42 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty David Rashid.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to an amended count 1 - Receiving stolen property-a firearm in violation of 943.34(1)(bm) and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Rashit concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as amended and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Rashid.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years, consecutive.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $4,383.04 Joint & several w/co-defendant
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-12 months county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.  Court has no objection to electronic monitoring.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Court adjourned at 10:00 a.m.

Per Joel in the jail, the defendant is not in custody.  Writ schredded.
